question: What are innopoints?
answer: Innopoints are a reward system for students engaging in extracurricular activities. They can be exchanged for merch, canteen services, and dorm accommodation.

question: How to create a student club?
answer: Create a student club by visiting campuslife.innopolis.ru/clubs and clicking on 'Create my Club.' Contact [@VOSpiridonova](http://t.me/VOSpiridonova) for inquiries.
generated_answer:
To create a student club at Innopolis University, you can follow these steps:

1. Click on "Create my Club" button on campuslife.innopolis.ru/clubs.
2. Contact Evgeniia Dyuzhakova, the Student Clubs Advisor, for questions and suggestions at @janedyuzha_dyuzha or via Telegram at https://t.me/janedyuzha.
3. Choose a club name, description, and logo.
4. Fill out the application form with your club's details.
5. Wait for approval from the University.
6. Once approved, you can start recruiting members, planning events, and engaging in activities.
7. You can also apply for resource provision and promotion support from the University.
8. To succeed in the course, it is recommended to treat written assignments as a tool to help make decisions about developing your own business.
9. Participation is important, so coordinate with your team and show up regularly.
10. Reading recommended literature is optional but can provide a deeper understanding of the material.

Note: The specific steps and requirements may vary depending on the club and the University's policies. It is best to consult with the Student Clubs Advisor for more information and guidance.

question: How does the University support student clubs?
answer: Student clubs can apply for resources, promotion support, and participate in the Club League for points. Top clubs receive budgets for purchases, claim Higher Scholarships, and earn innopoints. Contact [@VOSpiridonova](http://t.me/VOSpiridonova) for queries and suggestions.
generated_answer:
The university supports student clubs in various ways. According to the information provided, here are some of the ways the university supports student clubs:

1. Resource provision: The university provides resources such as equipment and audience for student clubs.
2. Promotion support: The university promotes student clubs through channels and groups, providing them with a platform to showcase their activities and attract new members.
3. Club League: Student clubs participate in the Club League, where they can earn points based on various criteria. The top 20 clubs receive a budget at the end of each semester, while club leaders of top 20 clubs can claim points for a Higher Scholarship every semester and innopoints at the end of the academic year.
4. Networking opportunities: Student clubs provide networking opportunities for members to connect with other students, industry representatives, and alumni.
5. Practical experience: Participating in student clubs can provide practical experience in a particular field of study, allowing members to develop their skills and knowledge in a safe and supportive environment.
6. Self-awareness: Joining a student organization contributes to self-awareness, allowing members to learn more about themselves, their goals, and their strengths.
7. Educational opportunities: The university offers educational opportunities for alumni, including elective courses that can be attended as free listeners.
8. Employment supports: The university provides employment supports such as internships and vacancies, as well as meetings with industry representatives, which can be monitored in the channel.

question: Can I create an event at Innopolis University?
answer: Yes, form a team, plan the event stages, and fill the form on campuslife.innopolis.ru/events. Afterward, visit the 319 office.
generated_answer:
To create an event at Innopolis University, you need to form a team, plan all organization stages, and fill out a form on campuslife.innopolis.ru/events. After filling out the form, please visit room 319 for further assistance.

Innopolis University offers various events and projects where you can develop your soft skills by becoming a volunteer. You can find open opportunities on ipts.innopolis.university. To be able to earn innopoints, please log in using your inno email. You can also create your own project and preliminary agree with @VOSpiridonova. After closing the event on the website, you will be granted with innopoints.

To propose an elective course, you need to provide the title, short description, prerequisites, intended learning outcomes, and a list of topics to be covered during the course. You can also provide links to GitHub repos, presentations, etc. The deadline for proposing a course for the Summer term 2022 is April 10th, while the deadline for the Fall term 2022 is June 15th. Please send your proposals to bmp@innopolis.university.

If your elective course is chosen by the students, you will need to submit a CV and other documents, go through an interview, and deliver a lecture or lab to demonstrate your teaching skills and knowledge of the subject. If everything goes well, the course will be approved for delivery. Innopolis University has a standard selection process for both permanent and visiting professors arranged by the Faculty Support and Affairs department.

Innopolis University covers travel and other costs related to participation in educational activities and events in Innopolis University, as specified in the agreement. For more information, you can message .

question: How can I volunteer and get innopoints?
answer: Explore volunteering opportunities on ipts.innopolis.university using your inno email. Create your project, confirm it with [@VOSpiridonova](http://t.me/VOSpiridonova), and after closing the event on the website, you'll earn innopoints.
generated_answer:
To volunteer and earn innopoints at Innopolis University, follow these steps:

1. Check for open volunteering opportunities on ipts.innopolis.university, and log in using your inno email to access the platform.
2. Create your own project or agree with @VOSpiridonova before closing your event on the website.
3. After closing your event, you will be granted with innopoints, which can be exchanged for branded merchandise, monthly accommodation, and meals.
4. To expedite the process, you can submit a CV and other documents, and do an interview to demonstrate your teaching skills and knowledge of the subject. If all goes well, the course will be approved for delivery.
5. Keep in mind that innopoints are awarded for volunteering, managing student clubs, and other extracurricular activities.
6. For more information on innopoints and volunteering opportunities, visit the InnoStore or consult with university administrators.

Remember to plan your organization stages, fill out the form on campuslife.innopolis.ru/events, and visit 319 office after submitting the form. Good luck with your volunteering endeavors!
